p: Several molecular diagnostics tests such as Real Time-PCR for genes encoding the internal RNA-dependent RNA polymerase and Spike’s receptor binding domain, full genome analysis by next-generation sequencing (NGS), isothermal loop-mediated amplification of coronavirus (i-LACO), multiplex nucleic acid amplification, and microarray-based assays are in use currently for the laboratory confirmation of coronavirus infection [ 87– 89]. Full genome sequencing is the ultimate tool to study the origin and evolution of this novel virus, which has structural similarities to the earlier coronaviruses. That can also be helpful in guidance to the therapeutic outcome and genotyping.
